Literature Review: Leukotrienes are potent lipid mediators that play a crucial role in the regulation of immune responses and the pathogenesis of various diseases, including inflammatory and allergic disorders. The biosynthesis of leukotrienes involves a complex series of reactions that require the coordinated action of multiple enzymes. Recent advances in structural biology have significantly improved our understanding of the protein components of the leukotriene-synthesizing enzyme machinery, providing new opportunities for the development of targeted therapeutics.
